tn.text: AT: "Their weapons included bows, and they could use the bow with their right or left hands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The sling was strip of leather that allowed a person to throw a stone a great distance. A stone was placed in the middle while the person held the ends and swung it around in a circle. When one end was released, the stone flew toward the target.

This means that the smallest group of the army that a leader lead was 100. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This means that the largest group of the army that a leader lead was 1,000.

This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of March and the first part April on Western calendars. It is at the beginning of the spring season when the late rains come. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
